Header.Name: dataSetCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to the dataset. The function needs one parameter that will receive the dataset properties received from CDA

Header.Name: lineCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Trendlines. The function needs one parameter that will receive the trendline properties

Header.Name: dataSetCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to series. The function needs one parameter that will receive the series name property received from the CDA

Header.Name: dataCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to data if it is separated by series (Otherwise use Data Series Callback). The function needs two parameters that will receive the series name and the data

Header.Name: categoryCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Categories. The function needs one parameter that will receive the categories properties

Header.Name: lineCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Trendlines. The function needs one parameter that will receive the trendline properties

Header.Name: lineCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Trendlines. The function needs one parameter that will receive the trendline properties

Header.Name: cdaArray
Header.Tooltip: Array of Paths and DataAccess ID's for the Multi-series Stacked Column 2D

Header.Name: dataSetCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to series. The function needs one parameter that will receive the series properties that got from the CDA

Header.Name: dataCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to data if it is separated by series (Otherwise use Data Series Callback). The function needs two parameters that will receive the series name and the data

Header.Name: linesetCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to lineset series. The function needs one parameter that will receive the series properties

Header.Name: linesetDataCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to data. The function needs two parameters that will receive the series name and the data

Header.Name: categoryCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Categories. The function needs one parameter that will receive the categories properties

Header.Name: lineCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Trendlines. The function needs one parameter that will receive the trendline properties

Header.Name: cdaArray
Header.Tooltip: Array of Paths and DataAccess ID's for the Multi-series Stacked Column 2D + Line Dual Y Axis Chart

Value.display: Multi-series 2D Single Y Combination Chart (Column + Line + Area)
Multi-series 3D Single Y Combination Chart (Column + Line + Area)
Multi-series Column 3D + Line - Single Y Axis
Stacked Column2D + Line single Y Axis
Stacked Column3D + Line single Y Axis
Multi-series 2D Dual Y Combination Chart (Column + Line + Area)
Multi-series Column 3D + Line - Dual Y Axis
Stacked Column 3D + Line Dual Y Axis
Multi-series Stacked Column 2D + Line Dual Y Axis

Header.Name: taskCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Tasks. The function needs one parameter that will receive the tasks properties

Header.Name: processCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Processes. The function needs one parameter that will receive the process properties

Header.Name: datacolumnCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Datacolumns in Datatables. The function needs one parameter that will receive the Datacolumn properties

Header.Name: textCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Texts in Datacolumns. The function needs two parameters that will receive the datacolumn headertext and the text properties

Header.Name: milestoneCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Milestones. The function needs one parameter that will receive the Milestone properties

Header.Name: connectorCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Connectors. The function needs one parameter that will receive the Connector properties

Header.Name: categoriesCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Categories. The function needs one parameter that will receive the categories properties

Header.Name: categoryCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Category. The function needs two parameters that will receive the Category Name and the properties

Header.Name: plotborderalpha
Header.Tooltip: Alpha for data plot border of this data-set

Header.Name: allowdrag
Header.Tooltip: Whether to allow the end users to drag the nodes belonging to this data-set

Header.Name: dataSetCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to nodes. The function needs one parameter that will receive the node properties

Header.Name: alpha
Header.Tooltip: Alpha for all the connectors on the chart.

Header.Name: arrowAtEnd
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show arrows at the end point of connectors

Header.Name: arrowAtStart
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show arrows at the origin of connectors

Header.Name: connectorColor
Header.Tooltip: Color for all the connectors on the chart

Header.Name: dashGap
Header.Tooltip: If the connectors are to appear as dashed, this attribute lets you define the gap between two consecutive dashes

Header.Name: dashLen
Header.Tooltip: If the connectors are to appear as dashed, this attribute lets you define the length of each dash

Header.Name: dashed
Header.Tooltip: Whether the connectors on the chart should appear as dashed

Header.Name: connectorCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to connectors. The function needs one parameter that will receive the connector properties

Header.Name: lineCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Trendlines. The function needs one parameter that will receive the trendline properties

Header.Name: vlineCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to Trendlines. The function needs one parameter that will receive the trendline properties

Header.Name: labelCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to labels. The function needs one parameter that will receive the label properties

Header.Name: dataSetCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to data. The function needs one parameter that will receive the data properties that got from CDA

Header.Name: colorCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to color. The function needs one parameter that will receive the color properties that got from CDA

Header.Name: itemsCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to items. The function needs one parameter that will receive the items properties that got from CDA

Header.Name: connectorsCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to connectors. The function needs one parameter that will receive the connectors properties that got from CDA

Header.Name: shapesCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to shapes. The function needs one parameter that will receive the shapes properties that got from CDA

Header.Name: entityDefCallback
Header.Tooltip: Apply properties to entityDef. The function needs one parameter that will receive the entityDef properties that got from CDA

Header.Name: useMarkers
Header.Tooltip: Use the CDA Data as Markers or Data

Header.Name: canvasBgColor
Header.Tooltip: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.

Header.Name: canvasBorderThickness
Header.Tooltip: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.

Header.Name: bgColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute

Header.Name: showBorder
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?

Header.Name: refreshInterval
Header.Tooltip: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data

Header.Name: clearChartInterval
Header.Tooltip: The time after which the chart will keep clearing its contents.

Header.Name: numDisplaySets
Header.Description: Max number of data points to plot
Header.Tooltip: This value helps you specify the number of data items that you want as history on the chart. For example, when you set it as 50, only 50 data items (per dataset) will be displayed on the chart. As soon as the 51st data comes in, the first data will be deleted and the rest of the data will be shifted by 1 position left - the new data will come and take the last position.

Header.Name: showYAxisValues
Header.Tooltip: The y-axis of charts is divided into vertical sections using div (divisional) lines. Each div line assumes a value based on its position. Using this attribute you can set whether to show those div line (y-axis) values or not

Header.Name: showLabels
Header.Tooltip: It sets the configuration whether the x-axis labels will be displayed or not.

Header.Name: labelDisplay
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you can control how your data labels (x-axis labels) will appear on the chart. There are 4 options: WRAP, STAGGER, ROTATE or NONE. WRAP wraps the label text if it's longer than the allotted area. ROTATE rotates the label in vertical or slanted position. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.

Header.Name: slantLabels
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.

Header.Name: labelStep
Header.Tooltip: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attributes just lets you do so. It allows you to display every n(th) X-axis label.

Header.Name: showValues
Header.Tooltip: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.

Header.Name: placeValuesInside
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show data values, you can show them inside the columns using this attribute. By default, the data values show outside the column.

Header.Name: rotateValues
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.

Header.Name: showLegend
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show legend for the chart (only multi-series and combination charts)?

Header.Name: legendPosition
Header.Tooltip: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below the chart (BOTTOM) and on the RIGHT side of the chart.

Header.Name: formatNumber
Header.Tooltip: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 ifformatNumber='0'.

Header.Name: numberPrefix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000.

Header.Name: numberSuffix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. For more details, please seeAdvanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: decimals
Header.Tooltip: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: formatNumberScale
Header.Tooltip: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end

Header.Name: baseFont
Header.Tooltip: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify outCnvBaseFont attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.

Header.Name: baseFontSize
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

Header.Name: baseFontColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

Header.Name: categoriesColor
Header.Tooltip: Sets the color for each categorie acording to de category index. ONLY on Multi Series Charts and Real Time Charts

Header.Name: canvasBgColor
Header.Tooltip: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.

Header.Name: canvasBorderThickness
Header.Tooltip: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.

Header.Name: bgColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute

Header.Name: showBorder
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?

Header.Name: refreshInterval
Header.Tooltip: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data

Header.Name: clearChartInterval
Header.Tooltip: The time after which the chart will keep clearing its contents.

Header.Tooltip: This value helps you specify the number of data items that you want as history on the chart. Header.Name: stack100Percent
Header.Tooltip: Setting this attribute to 1 helps in depicting the values in percentage figures. When this attribute is set to 1 the chart considers the total of the stacked dataplot as 100% and the Y-Axis shows a scale from 0% to 100%.

Header.Name: showPercentValues
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show percentage figures in data values of the chart.

Header.Name: showPercentInToolTip
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show percentage figures in tooltip.

Header.Name: canvasBgColor
Header.Tooltip: Sets Canvas background color. For Gradient effect, enter colors separated by comma.

Header.Name: canvasBorderThickness
Header.Tooltip: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.

WRAP wraps the label text if it's longer than the allotted area. ROTATE rotates the label in vertical or slanted position. STAGGER divides the labels into multiple lines.

Header.Name: slantLabels
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show rotated labels on chart, this attribute lets you set the configuration whether the labels will show as slanted labels or fully vertical ones.

Header.Name: labelStep
Header.Tooltip: By default, all the labels are displayed on the chart. However, if you've a set of streaming data (like name of months or days of week), you can opt to show every n-th label for better clarity. This attributes just lets you do so. It allows you to display every n(th) X-axis label.

Header.Name: showValues
Header.Tooltip: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.

Header.Name: placeValuesInside
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show data values, you can show them inside the columns using this attribute. By default, the data values show outside the column.

Header.Name: rotateValues
Header.Tooltip: If you've opted to show data values, you can rotate them using this attribute.

Header.Name: showLegend
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show legend for the chart (only multi-series and combination charts)?

Header.Name: legendPosition
Header.Tooltip: The legend can be plotted at two positions on the chart - below the chart (BOTTOM) and on the RIGHT side of the chart.

Header.Name: formatNumber
Header.Tooltip: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 ifformatNumber='0'.

Header.Name: numberPrefix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000.

Header.Name: numberSuffix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. For more details, please seeAdvanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: decimals
Header.Tooltip: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: formatNumberScale
Header.Tooltip: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end

Header.Name: baseFont
Header.Tooltip: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify outCnvBaseFont attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.

Header.Name: baseFontSize
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

Header.Name: baseFontColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

Header.Name: categoriesColor
Header.Tooltip: Sets the color for each categorie acording to de category index. ONLY on Multi Series Charts and Real Time Charts

Header.Name: sYAxisValueDecimals
Header.Tooltip: Decimal places for y-axis values on secondary y-axis.

Header.Name: isDataStreamAngularGauge
Header.Tooltip: Enable the Data Stream Angular Gauge

Header.Name: bgColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute

Header.Name: showBorder
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?

Header.Name: showValues
Header.Tooltip: Sets the configuration whether data values will be displayed along with the data plot on chart.

Header.Name: valueBelowPivot
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show dial value below the pivot or above it?

Header.Name: lowerLimitDisplay
Header.Tooltip: This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the lower limit. For example, in a chart displaying Literacy Rate on a scale of 0-100%, you may need to show the label Low at the starting point of the chart. Upon using this attribute to specify the label, the value 0 will be replaced by Low. Default value: If you do not specify the lowerLimitDisplay attribute, the lower limit value will be shown.

Header.Name: upperLimitDisplay
Header.Tooltip: This attribute allows you to display a label instead of the upper limit. Upon using this attribute, the upper limit of the chart gets replaced by the label specified. Default value: If you do not specify the upperLimitDisplay attribute, the upper limit value will be shown.

Header.Name: showLimits
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show the first and last tick value (i.e., chart lower and upper limit)?

Header.Name: placeTicksInside
Header.Tooltip: Whether to place ticks inside the gauge (on the inner radius) or outside?

Header.Name: placeValuesInside
Header.Tooltip: Whether to place tick values inside the gauge?

Header.Name: autoAlignTickValues
Header.Tooltip: Whether to ask the chart to automatically place tick values to reduce overlapping of the tick values with the gauge.

Header.Name: refreshInterval
Header.Tooltip: For this parameter, you can specify the number of seconds after which the chart will look for new data

Header.Name: formatNumber
Header.Tooltip: This configuration determines whether the numbers displayed on the chart will be formatted using commas, e.g., 40,000 if formatNumber='1' and 40000 ifformatNumber='0'.

Header.Name: numberPrefix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add prefix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all dollars figure on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' $' to show like $40000, $50000.

Header.Name: numberSuffix
Header.Tooltip: Using this attribute, you could add suffix to all the numbers visible on the graph. For example, to represent all figure quantified as per annum on the chart, you could specify this attribute to ' /a' to show like 40000/a, 50000/a. For more details, please seeAdvanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: decimals
Header.Tooltip: Number of decimal places to which all numbers on the chart will be rounded to. For more details, please see Advanced Charting > Number Formatting section.

Header.Name: formatNumberScale
Header.Tooltip: Configuration whether to add K (thousands) and M (millions) to a number after truncating and rounding it - e.g., if formatNumberScale is set to 1, 1043 will become 1.04K (with decimals set to 2 places). Same with numbers in millions - an M will be added at the end

Header.Name: baseFont
Header.Tooltip: This attribute lets you set the font face (family) of all the text (data labels, values etc.) on chart. If you specify outCnvBaseFont attribute also, then this attribute controls only the font face of text within the chart canvas bounds.

Header.Name: baseFontSize
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font size of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font size provided here.

Header.Name: baseFontColor
Header.Tooltip: This attribute sets the base font color of the chart i.e., all the values and the names in the chart which lie on the canvas will be displayed using the font color provided here.

Header.Name: gaugeStartAngle
Header.Tooltip: Angle from where the gauge will start drawing. Default value is 180.

Header.Name: gaugeEndAngle
Header.Tooltip: Angle where the gauge will end drawing. Default value is 0.

Header.Name: showGaugeBorder
Header.Tooltip: Whether to show a border around gauge scale?

Header.Name: gaugeBorderColor
Header.Tooltip: Color of gauge scale border. You can either specify a hex code here (like 333333), or a single token from gradient fill mix like {dark-20} or {light-30}. The chart will then calculate the border color for each color range individually (based on the color code for each color range).

Header.Name: colorRange
Header.Tooltip: Colors to use in the intervals range.

Header.Name: rangeValues
Header.Tooltip: Array - Intervals to use on the dial
